intro: Protium laxiflorum var. fendleri, commonly known as the Mexican wild silk tree, is a member of the Burseraceae family. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to southern Mexico and parts of Central America. The plant is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape. Its flowers are small, fragrant, and clustered in panicles, typically appearing in the spring. The tree produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed, and it is often found in moist, well-drained soils in lowland tropical forests.
